isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (356 MM) AND 15 1/2-INCH (394 MM) TWO-PLATE, PULL-TYPE CLUTCH - CLEAN AND INSPECT - INSPECT

svcsubproc.title: Intermediate Plate
svcsubproc.para: Inspect friction surfaces of intermediate plate for heat checks, scoring or distortion. Inspect drive slots or drive lugs of the intermediate plate for wear. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS.

svcsubproc.title: Transmission Clutch Housing and Engine Flywheel Housing
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the mating surfaces of the transmission clutch housing and engine flywheel housing ( Figure 18). Any appreciable wear on either housing will cause misalignment. Replace housing if worn. Most wear will be found on the lower half of the mating surfaces. Most common wear areas are between the 3 and 8 o'clock positions ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Most Common Wear Areas Between 3 and 8 O'Clock Positions

step1.para: Secure a dial indicator to engine flywheel or crankshaft ( Figure 20) and set the dial indicator finger against the housing pilot.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Secure Dial Indicator to Engine Flywheel or Crankshaft

step1.para: With chalk or soapstone, mark the high and low points. Total indicated difference between the high and low points must be .008 inch (.203 mm) or less.
Move the dial indicator finger to contact face of the engine flywheel housing ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Move Dial Indicator Finger to Contact Face of Engine Flywheel Housing

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel and mark high and low points. Total runout should not exceed .008" (.203 mm).
Secure dial indicator to engine flywheel housing with the dial indicator finger on the surface of the flywheel and near the outer edge ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Make Sure Dial Indicator is on Surface of Flywheel

step1.para: Rotate flywheel. Maximum permissible runout is .0005" per inch of flywheel diameter (.013 mm per mm). For instance, with a 14" (356 mm) clutch, .007" (.178 mm) is allowable.
Move the dial indicator finger to contact pilot bearing bore surface ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Move Dial Indicator Finger to Contact Pilot Bearing Bore Surface

step1.para: Rotate the flywheel. Maximum total allowable runout is .005 inch (.127 mm).

caution.para: If any of these limits is exceeded, the problem must be corrected or the resulting misalignment will cause premature wear to the drive train components.
